description: Cooper Kupp is set to play tonight against the Cardinals, fully recovered from previous injuries. After being released by the Rams in 2025, he joined the Seahawks and has recorded 11 receptions for 136 yards this season. The Seahawks plan to utilize Kupp's experience and precision, making him a key playmaker in their offensive strategy.

B'luru traffic chaos: Wipro rejects CM's request - his 'no silver bullet' reply
description: Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah requested Wipro to allow public vehicular access through its Bengaluru campus to alleviate traffic congestion on the Outer Ring Road. Azim Premji declined, citing operational, security, and legal concerns related to the campus's status as a Special Economic Zone. Wipro proposed funding a comprehensive study for long-term solutions.

Ladakh protest: MHA cancels FCRA license of Wangchuk's NGO
description: The Ministry of Home Affairs has cancelled the FCRA certificate of Sonam Wangchuk's SECMOL following a CBI inquiry. The ministry cited several violations of the FCRA, including discrepancies in financial transactions, misuse of funds, and acceptance of foreign contributions for activities deemed inappropriate. This action coincides with recent unrest in Ladakh over demands for statehood and constitutional protections.

description: Marvin Harrison Jr. will play for the Arizona Cardinals against the Seattle Seahawks. He is fully fit after recovering from minor knee soreness. Enumerators faced issues with the mobile application and network connectivity.

Students can start preparing based on this schedule, focusing on conceptual understanding, regular practice, and revision. Practical exams will also be conducted alongside theory papers, and following structured preparation strategies can help students boost performance.

description: Sameer Wankhede has filed a defamation suit in Delhi high court against Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment, Netflix, and others over Aryan Khan’s directorial debut series, alleging it damages his reputation and undermines anti-drug enforcement agencies. Wankhede seeks damages of Rs 2 crore and a restraint on the show's streaming, claiming it misrepresents events and violates national honor laws.

Nighttime symptoms that reveal your heart, liver, and kidney health
description: Recurring nighttime disturbances, such as chest discomfort, itching, or frequent urination, may signal underlying health issues related to the heart, liver, or kidneys. Nighttime is crucial for detecting these problems as bodily functions shift, revealing issues not noticeable during the day. Ignoring persistent symptoms like breathlessness, leg cramps, or swelling can lead to severe complications.

title: 'Baby, I love you': Shocking details in Delhi 'godman' case; deleted chats under lens
description: A 21-year-old Delhi student has accused Chaitanyananda Saraswati, head of an institute, of persistent sexual harassment. The FIR details inappropriate WhatsApp messages and coercive behavior. Saraswati, already facing multiple charges including fraud and molestation from previous incidents, is currently on the run as police investigate these new allegations, including claims he targeted vulnerable students with promises and threats.

title: The reverse migration trend: Why leaving US is becoming new smart move for Indians
description: Many Indian professionals are returning from the US, driven by rising visa costs, burnout, and a desire for family closeness. One Reddit user's story highlights this trend, detailing their move back to India after 11 years in the US. They doubled their wealth by starting a consulting business and enjoying a better work-life balance in a Tier-2 city.

title: Heart disease and leg pain, PAD symptoms explained, when aches mean something more
description: Leg pain during walking could signal Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD), indicating clogged arteries and increased risk of heart attack and stroke. Early detection through tests like ABI is crucial, especially for those with risk factors such as smoking or diabetes. Addressing PAD through lifestyle changes and medical interventions can protect both legs and heart.

title: Bill Gates credits 15 Indian engineers, says they built Microsoft; viral video
description: Amidst H-1B visa fee hikes and debates, a resurfaced video shows Bill Gates recalling Microsoft's early recruitment of Indian engineers from IITs in the 1980s. Gates emphasizes that this decision was crucial for Microsoft's growth, despite initial criticism about brain drain and concerns over American jobs.

title: Andre Agassi & Steffi Graf net worth 2025: Legacy, family & fortune
description: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf, tennis legends with a combined fortune of $290 million in 2025, continue to impact the sport. Agassi captained Team World to victory at the Laver Cup, while Graf dedicates her time to family and charitable endeavors. Their children, Jaden and Jaz, were seen supporting their father at the Laver Cup, highlighting their enduring family legacy.

title: Ukrainian woman opens up after getting married to Indian; remembers how her life changd
description: Viktoriia Chakraborty, a Ukrainian woman married to an Indian man, is winning hearts online by embracing Indian culture. After living in India for eight years, she shared her experiences of adopting local customs, including wearing sarees and eating with her hands. Viktoriia's Instagram video showcasing her love for Indian traditions has gone viral, with many praising her integration and happiness.

title: US H-1B $100K fees: Netflix calls it “tax"; founder says it will end lotteries
description: Netflix co-founder Reed Hastings supports Donald Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, a move that contrasts with the widespread criticism from Silicon Valley leaders. While Hastings believes the fee will ensure H-1B visas are reserved for high-value jobs, the White House clarified it's a one-time payment for new petitions only, causing confusion and concern among tech companies, especially startups.
